column5: Hey all.  So as some of you know I have a dry river bed by my house that have Rainbows come up to spawn in the spring.  Well my kids were down there today and found about 50 or more baby rainbow fry stuck in a small pool of water (with NO WAY to get out).  So here is my question as my kids want me to "save the baby fish!".  Can I take them in a bucket and move them farther down in the same water system so they have a chance to live?  It's all part of the same creek but this is the spot where the creek begins to form.  I can walk less then 10 min. and have the trapped fry in healthy river (same river) waters.  I have a feeling the answer is no but I have to ask, they (the kids) are bugging me...  Thanks.  Geoff
I would say just do it and not post it on a forum
i agree with Joey do it and don't say anything, i do not think anybody would say anything about it you are saving the fish.   we must do all we can to save the fishing for our younger generations
They will stand a better chance then drying up in the puddle....Just do what you got to do....
Come on Geoff. Save the little fishies. You will be a hero to your kids
that I would never do... save the fish however I just might do.      let's see what the kids want to do then.
LOL Your odds are now higher of actually getting in trouble (if its even a problem) after posting this.
oh that I know; but I wear an APE costume and only work at night under the cover of darkness...
trust me, when the kids showed them to me they were/are quick!  I know I can NEVER get more then 2 at a time...
r u going to pay a fine if i do it and get one?
Ill help you . That makes 4 at a time and a couple pops!?
it's not like you are introducing anything.  giv'er!
Just run a line of marshmellows from the dried up creek, to the open water... they'll drag themselves there, whilst enjoying one of their favorite meals. HH
